content.description: Overhanging sport route.Climb a few bouldery moves, then pull a small roof, cruise pockets and jugs on the head wall.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Two bolt anchor. Stick clip. SA toprope can be setup carefully from above.
content.location: From the Memorial Overlook parking lot, hike west (right when facing lake) on the trail for a minute until you come to a sewage lagoon on the right and large pipe leading down to the lower level to the left. Carefully follow the pipe down to the lower trail about 25 vertical feet down. When you hit the ground, follow the wall immediately on your left about 20 feet to the bolted route.

content.description: Two bolt anchor.Climb a few balancy moves to a tough sequence that gains the flake on the face.
content.location: From the Memorial Overlook parking lot, hike west (right when facing lake) on the trail for a minute until you come to a sewage lagoon on the right and large pipe leading down to the lower level to the left. Carefully follow the pipe down to the lower trail about 25 vertical feet down. When you hit the ground, follow the rock wall around to your left, there will be two bolted routes on the wall.

content.description: Two bolt anchor.Climb a few easy moves to a difficult  sequence of dimples and edges.
content.location: From the Memorial Overlook parking lot, hike west (right when facing lake) on the trail for a minute until you come to a sewage lagoon on the right and large pipe leading down to the lower level to the left. Carefully follow the pipe down to the lower trail about 25 vertical feet down. When you hit the ground, follow the rock wall around to your left, there will be two bolted routes on the wall.

content.description: Four bolt sport route just left of a tree. Two bolt anchor with two quick links. You can setup a toprope from above if you are very careful. I would suggest tying in to a tree before leaning over the edge.
content.location: From the Memorial Overlook parking lot, hike west (right when facing lake) on the trail for a minute until you come to a sewage lagoon on the right and large pipe leading down to the lower level to the left. Carefully follow the pipe down to the lower trail about 25 vertical feet down, and turn immediately to your right and look up.

content.description: Climb up slab doing reachy moves past 4 bolts. You can top this climb out, but there is loose rock above the last bolt, so be cautious.
content.protection: 4 bolts, no anchors. I left a quick link on the last bolt to lower off. An anchor could be built using trees at the top of the climb.
content.location: In the middle of the Memorial Wall. It is currently the only bolted line.

content.description: Pretty good climb, but I didn't zip it up like I should have. I used a green #.75 BDC3 in a good sized pocket 1/3 of the way up, then threaded a sling in a hole 2/3 of the way up. Feet start to crumble near the top out above the threaded sling, but it gets juggy so it shouldn't be a huge issue.There are plenty of placement options for tri-cams and stoppers, but the way that I protected it is the reason why I gave it an "R" rating. If you zipped it up, this would be a PG-13.Belay a second off the live tree at the top (backup the tree with a cam under the boulder if you want), or rappel down to clean, and hike up the pipe corridor to retrieve your anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack of cams, 60cm slings for multiple treading spots, and tri-cams would be helpful in small pockets,
content.location: From the Memorial Overlook parking lot, hike west (right when facing lake) on the trail for 2-3 minutes until you come to a sewage lagoon on the right and large pipe leading down to the lower level to the left. Carefully follow the pipe down to the lower trail about 25 vertical feet down, then continue further west on the lower trail about 100 feet around one corner and you will see the wall this route is on.

content.description: Climbs the blue face on pockets.
content.location: Located on a detached boulder left of the steel pipe. This large boulder is known as the Sunflower Boulder

climbs.name: Secret Entrance to The Lollipop Guild

content.description: Enjoyable and easy face climbing that follows up a system of flakes. The route was naturally fairly clean on a warm, sunny December day and pleasantly light on choss and loose rock, although it had some spiderwebs in the big upper flake when I had scouted it out earlier in the summer.It protected well with a standard rack of cams; be cautious not to place gear behind/in any of the thinner flakes or pods. I would recommend bringing tri-cams for the pods and horizontal cracks, but not required.Belay a second off the live tree at the top (backup the tree with a cam under the boulder if you want), or rappel down to clean, and hike up the pipe corridor to retrieve your anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack of cams. Tri-cams are a bonus.
content.location: From the Memorial Overlook parking lot, hike west (right when facing lake) on the trail for 2-3 minutes until you come to a sewage lagoon on the right and large pipe leading down to the lower level to the left. Carefully follow the pipe down to the lower trail about 25 vertical feet down, then continue further west on the lower trail about 100 feet around one corner and you will see the wall this route is on.

content.description: Top-rope route with a reachy move to a ledge. Tree anchor. Avoid the giant pipe.
content.protection: Top-rope. Static rope or cordelette for a tree anchor.
content.location: From the Memorial Overlook parking lot, hike west (right when facing lake) on the trail for a minute until you come to a sewage lagoon on the right and large pipe leading down to the lower level to the left. Carefully follow the pipe down to the lower trail about 25 vertical feet down. When you hit the ground, the route starts immediately on your left.

content.description: Climbs a steep pocketed face to a stopper move below the anchors.

Starts as a juggy dihedral along a crack then ends with an exciting finish stemming over a small, crimpy chimney. Beware of debris and sharp rocks in the chimney, consider keeping the rope running outside to the left when you are below it.
content.location: After traveling down the pipe corridor, continue west another couple minutes until you come across the pictured route.

content.description: This wall faces west, so has morning shade and afternoon sun. It is about 15-25' tall, with lots of trees at the top for anchors. A helmet is strongly recommended as many of the lines have lots of potentially loose holds. Also, be aware that you are below the parking lot, and with all the broken glass, you might end up being in the line of fire for litterers.
